meta.name: description
meta.content: San Francisco Unified School District (SFUSD) is the seventh largest school district in California, educating over 57,000 students every year. San Francisco is both a city and a county; therefore, SFUSD administers both the school district and the San Francisco County Office of Education (COE). This makes SFUSD a “single district county.”

div.p: All SFUSD schools are closed through the end of the school year. Get free meals, find learning and other resources, access FAQs, and get updates on COVID-19.

li.a: Families
Students
Employees
Community
Job Seekers

img.alt: Small San Francisco Unified School District Logo
San Francisco Unified School District Logo

li.a: About

Our Mission and Vision
Learn about Vision 2025, the districtwide plans supporting it, and our core values

Board of Education
Meet the commissioners and find meeting agendas and schedules

Our Team
Meet our leadership team and employees, and recognize outstanding employees

Budget & LCAP
Learn how budgets and the Local Control and Accountability Plan are created

News
Read about what's new at SFUSD

Contact Us
Find out how to submit a records request or contact departments and schools
Schools

Enroll in SFUSD Schools
Learn how and when to apply and enroll in school and how the student assignment process works

Our Schools
View all our schools by grade level

School Search
Search for schools by filtering for language programs, before- and afterschool programs, special education, and more

Schools & the Community
Learn how our schools contribute to the community and tap into community resources
Learning

Curriculum & Assessments
See what we're teaching, how we assess student learning, and opportunities for learning outside the classroom

Special Education
Learn about special education assessments, Individual Education Plans (IEPs) and more

English Language Learners
Find out about English Learner programs, assessments and reclassification

Language Pathways
We have language pathways for learning non-English languages and for English Learners

Resources
Learn more about student technology tools, school libraries, textbooks and classroom materials

New Approaches to Learning
Find out how we're redesigning learning in and out of the classroom
Services

Student Supports & Programs
See how we are supporting Special Education students, English Learners, migrant students, foster youth, LGBTQ youth, and refugee and immigrant youth

Student Services
Find out how to request a transcript, make up credits, request transportation, or learn about available counseling services

Health & Wellness
View school menus, learn about our nutritional program, and find out about health requirements for enrolling in school

Family Supports & Services
Check out our family toolkit for school engagement, learn how to sign up for school and district notifications, request translation or interpretation, or report a concern

Safety & Emergency
Learn about school safety and emergency preparation

Know Your Rights
Know your rights as an SFUSD family member or student and learn about SFUSD policies
Calendars

Calendars
View the academic calendar, district and school events, and community-sponsored events.

Submit an Event
Submit an event for inclusion on our website calendars
Connect

Get Involved
Participate in the SFUSD community by investing in our students, volunteering or advising the Board

Community Partners
Get a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to partner with SFUSD or learn about our Community Partnership Network

Vendors
Learn about the bidding and RFP process and view current invitations for bids, RFPs, RFQs, RFOs, and RFIs

Contact Us
Find out how to submit a records request, view our organization chart, or contact departments and schools

div.class: js-form-item form-item js-form-type-textfield form-type-textfield js-form-item-search-api-fulltext form-item-search-api-fulltext
div.label: Search Site

img.alt: Superintendent Vincent Matthews recording en episode of SF Loves Learning

div.p: SFUSD is partnering with KTVU to provide an hour-long television episode especially for PK-2nd grade students in San Francisco. Watch on KTVU Plus from 2-3 pm Mondays-Fridays.

a.aria-label: Read more about SF Loves Learning

div.p: Check your email or this website to view a digest of school closure related information and resources every Monday, Wednesday and Friday evening.

a.aria-label: Read more about Stay Connected During School Closures

div.p: Get home options for learning that include a variety of subject areas, and support for our English learners, students with disabilities, and diverse populations.

img.alt: Two cafeteria staff in front of cartons of milk and fruit

div.p: SFUSD is providing free breakfast, lunch, and supper to all children at pick-up sites across San Francisco. No identification or proof of school enrollment is required.

a.aria-label: Read more about Free Meals Available

div.h2: Talking to Children about the Coronavirus

div.p: Ongoing developments may be overwhelming, especially to younger children. Families can help by discussing their concerns.

a.aria-label: Read more about Talking to Children about the Coronavirus

div.h3: Sign Up For TK-2 Learning Tips Via Text Message
div.div: Text SFUSD to 70138 to receive 3 texts a week with fun facts and tips on ways to help children learn and grow.

a.aria-label: Read more about Sign Up For TK-2 Learning Tips Via Text Message

div.div: SFUSD has many technology resources for families to support distance learning. Click here for more information.

a.aria-label: Read more about Technology Resources for Distance Learning

div.h3: Free Meals Available During School Closure
div.div: Free grab and go meals are available for families to pick up on Mondays and Wednesdays. Learn more about food resources in San Francisco.

a.aria-label: Read more about Free Meals Available During School Closure

div.div: Find age-appropriate activities for your kids at home.
SFUSD is providing free meals for all children. No identification or proof of school enrollment is required.
Resources from nonprofits, community organizations and city departments for families during SFUSD's school closure.
We're sending an update to families three times a week with new information and more.

li.class: field field--name-field-link-items field--type-link field--label-hidden link-item field__item
li.a: Staff Digest

li.class: field field--name-field-link-items field--type-link field--label-hidden link-item field__item
li.a: Distance-Learning Resources

li.class: field field--name-field-link-items field--type-link field--label-hidden link-item field__item
li.a: Log in for COVID-19 Resources

div.div: The Board of Education will meet as a Committee of the Whole on Tuesday, April 21, 2020 at 3:00 p.m. The Board of Education will meet in Regular Session on Tuesday, April 28 at 3:00 p.m. Check back for details on joining virtual meeting.
View district and school events and the academic calendar.

div.h3: SFUSD Airs Original Educational TV Show on KTVU Plus
div.div: “SF Loves Learning” will air on weekdays, supports home-based education program for preschool to 2nd grade students

div.h3: SFUSD Begins Teacher-Led Interactive Distance Learning
div.div: Students have both digital and non-digital options for education from home, including more opportunities to interact with teachers and peers.

div.h3: Donations of Goods and Services Support Students During School Closures
div.div: The San Francisco Unified School District has received and deployed dozens of in-kind donations to support students and families during extended school closures.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-quote field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: As a teacher, I have always believed that equity and justice meant being the best possible teacher I could be for my students.

cite.div: Spanish Teacher - Abraham Lincoln High School

img.alt: Danielle Brown Sanchez, Parent at Dolores Huerta Elementary School

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-quote field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item

span.span: I wanted to take a minute to thank all who were involved in providing Chromebooks for the students to borrow.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-quote field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item

span.span: I want to study Political Science in college because I want to be a Civil Rights attorney.

cite.div: Senior at Galileo Academy of Science and Technology, Student Emcee for the 2020 African American Honor Roll

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-quote field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: My supervisor trusts me to do the work, knowing that I understand the vision and I'm going to truly partner with the children and families.

cite.div: Family Liaison Coordinator at Shoestrings Children's Center

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-quote field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: The key to dealing with kids is you talk up to them, you don’t talk down.

cite.div: Head of Security at Willie L. Brown Jr. Middle School

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-quote field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: I think being fearless makes you the best player you can be. You’re fearless to make mistakes and trust your teammates, which is a big part of volleyball.

cite.div: Senior at Lowell High School & 2019 Lowell Varsity Volleyball Team State Champion

img.alt: Meena Jamerson, Grandparent at Dr. William L. Cobb Elementary School

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-quote field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item

span.span: My granddaughter loves it here, and she’s always a good student.

cite.div: Grandparent at Dr. William L. Cobb Elementary School

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-field-quote field--type-text-long field--label-hidden field__item

span.span: When I’m out on the field, I just want to play hard for everyone on my team.

cite.div: Senior at Lincoln High School & 2019 Lincoln Varsity Football Team State Champion

div.h2: Subscribe to our family email newsletter
div.div: Sign up for our monthly newsletter for tips for families, the latest on what's happening at SFUSD and more.

li.a: Families
Students
Employees
Community
Job Seekers
Family Portal
Enroll
Calendars
School Menus
Know Your Rights
Report a Concern

div.p: Learn more about the new website, give us feedback, or visit the old website.

SFUSD's Family Resource Link provides families with access to district information and resources during distance learning through the rest of the school year. This service will not replace existing phone lines and support already provided by district departments. Families can email requests to familylink@sfusd.edu, call 415-340-1716 (M-F, 9 a.m.-1p.m.), or complete an online request form.

San Francisco Unified School District programs, activities, and practices shall be free from unlawful discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying based on actual or perceived race, color, ancestry, national origin, ethnic group identification, age, religion, marital or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, or gender expression; or on the basis of a person’s association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics. This policy extends to San Francisco County Office of Education, including community school programs and activities.

If you believe you have been subjected to discrimination, harassment, intimidation, or bullying, you should immediately contact the school site principal and/or Director of the Office of Equity (CCR Title 5 and Title IX Officer), Keasara (Kiki) Williams, at 415-355-7334 or equity@sfusd.edu. A copy of SFUSD’s uniform complaint policy and SFUSD’s non-discrimination policy are available upon request. Learn more about family and student rights.

li.a: Accessibility
Privacy policy
